revised_title: The Fixation of Arsenic by the Brain and its Implications for Salvarsan's Neurotropic Properties
tldr: The authors investigate the fixation of arsenic by the brain after intravenous injections of salvarsan and neosalvarsan. They find that the brain can fix considerable quantities of neosalvarsan, but it is unable to penetrate into the brain due to a peculiarity of the cerebral capillaries. This inability explains the lack of success in treating syphilitic lesions of the brain using salvarsan.
